page.title: 14ARTS AND CRAFTS IN WYDDIAL
page.content: At Wyddial Hall Mrs. Boyd_Carpenter is a professional embroiderer. She has no formal qualification but has worked at the Cambridge County Centre , where art and craft courses are held. Her speciality is gold work. Since 1969 she has undertaken commissions for ecclesiastical work. These included the copes and mitres worn by Dr. Robert Runcie Archbishop of Canterbury for his enthronement and for the wedding of H.R.H. Prince of Wales in 1977, also a cope for Wheathamstead Church, work for Salem Church in Broughton and an altar frontal for York Minster. She is just beginning five copes for Canterbury Cathedral. Only for very large items such as the York altar frontal does she enlist help.
